segment.source: What Is BitLocker Drive Encryption?
segment.target: What Is BitLocker Drive Encryption?

segment.source: BitLocker provides offline-data and operating-system protection for your computer.
segment.target: BitLocker provides offline-data and operating-system protection for your computer.

segment.source: BitLocker helps ensure that data that is stored on a computer that is running Windows® is not revealed if the computer is tampered with when the installed operating system is offline.
segment.target: BitLocker helps ensure that data that is stored on a computer that is running Windows® is not revealed if the computer is tampered with when the installed operating system is offline.

segment.source: BitLocker uses a microchip that is called a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) to provide enhanced protection for your data and to preserve early boot-component integrity.
segment.target: BitLocker uses a microchip that is called a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) to provide enhanced protection for your data and to preserve early boot-component integrity.

segment.source: The TPM can help protect your data from theft or unauthorized viewing by encrypting the entire Windows volume.
segment.target: The TPM can help protect your data from theft or unauthorized viewing by encrypting the entire Windows volume.

segment.source: BitLocker is designed to offer the most seamless end-user experience with computers that have a compatible TPM microchip and BIOS.
segment.target: BitLocker is designed to offer the most seamless end-user experience with computers that have a compatible TPM microchip and BIOS.

segment.source: A compatible TPM is defined as a version 1.2 TPM that has the BIOS modifications that are required to support the Static Root of Trust Measurement, as defined by the Trusted Computing Group.
segment.target: A compatible TPM is defined as a version 1.2 TPM that has the BIOS modifications that are required to support the Static Root of Trust Measurement, as defined by the Trusted Computing Group.

segment.source: The TPM interacts with BitLocker to help provide seamless protection when the computer restarts.
segment.target: The TPM interacts with BitLocker to help provide seamless protection when the computer restarts.

segment.source: The path to the TPM driver file is %WINDIR%InfTpm.inf.
segment.target: The path to the TPM driver file is %WINDIR%InfTpm.inf.

segment.source: For information about how to add the TPM driver to Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), see WinPE: Mount and Customize.
segment.target: For information about how to add the TPM driver to Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), see WinPE: Mount and Customize.

segment.source: BitLocker Drive Encryption Partitioning Requirements
segment.target: BitLocker Drive Encryption Partitioning Requirements

segment.source: BitLocker must use a system partition that is separate from the Windows partition.
segment.target: BitLocker must use a system partition that is separate from the Windows partition.

segment.source: The system partition:
segment.target: The system partition:

segment.source: Must be configured as the active partition.
segment.target: Must be configured as the active partition.

segment.source: Must not be encrypted or used to store user files.
segment.target: Must not be encrypted or used to store user files.

segment.source: Must have at least 100 megabytes (MB) of space.
segment.target: Must have at least 100 megabytes (MB) of space.

segment.source: Must have at least 50 MB of free space.
segment.target: Must have at least 50 MB of free space.

segment.source: May be shared with a recovery partition.
segment.target: May be shared with a recovery partition.

segment.source: For more information about BitLocker partitioning requirements, see Hard Drives and Partitions Overview.
segment.target: For more information about BitLocker partitioning requirements, see Hard Drives and Partitions Overview.
